author: john_89
content: Hello can I ask, what is the highest fee to pay the network for any transaction here: https://ethgasstation.info/ . So as I see for less than 2 min waiting I pay $0.25? Is this correct? And this is for any transaction? So if I transfer ether worth $100 or $1 I will always pay $0.25?

author: timbeiko
content: The way the website shows things is a bit unintuitive: the priority fee value shown is only a small subset of the total gas fee. You need to add the base fee as well, which is shown below.

author: timbeiko
content: When you send a txn, you set both a max fee and a priority fee, the max fee is the maximum you are willing to pay, and the priority fee is the maximum that will go the the txn miner. What you actually pay is the sum of the priority fee you set, and the current base fee on the network, which goes up/down based on current usage.

author: timbeiko
content: So, tl;dr: you'll never pay more than a max see you set, but you need that fee to be >= to the current network's base fee, or your transaction will just stay pending forever. I find this website better to provide gas estimates: https://www.blocknative.com/gas-estimator
